CSImageViewer::ColorImageData

ColorImageData Class Reference

class containing the actual pixel data for a color image (3 values per pixel - red, green, and blue (rgb)) More...

Inheritance diagram for ColorImageData:

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 ColorImageData (Bitmap oldBM)
 Given a bitmap image, this ctor reads the image data, stores the raw pixel data in an array, and creates a displayable version of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in the bitmap.
 ColorImageData (Bitmap oldBM, Color[] oldPalette, int bpp)
 Given a bitmap image and a palette (i.e., color lookup table used to translate scalar image values into other color values), this ctor reads the image data, uses the lookup table to store the pixel data in an array, and creates a displayable version of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in the bitmap.
 ColorImageData (int[] unpacked, int w, int h)
 This ctor constructs a ColorImageData object from an array of rgb pixel values and the width and height of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in unpacked.
void unpacked_rgb_to_display (int[] unpacked)
 This function takes an unpacked int array of rgb pixel values (representing an entire image), and copies the values to mDisplayData (also representing an entire image). mDisplayImage is changed to these values as well. mOriginalData remains unchanged. Note that unpacked must be the same size as the original image (mW*mH).
int getRed (int row, int col)
 Given a pixel's row and column location, this function returns the value of the pixel's red component.
int getGreen (int row, int col)
 Given a pixel's row and column location, this function returns the value of the pixel's green component.
int getBlue (int row, int col)
 Given a pixel's row and column location, this function returns the value of the pixel's blue component.

Detailed Description

class containing the actual pixel data for a color image (3 values per pixel - red, green, and blue (rgb))

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ColorImageData (  Bitmap  oldBM  ) 
 

Given a bitmap image, this ctor reads the image data, stores the raw pixel data in an array, and creates a displayable version of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in the bitmap.

Parameters:
oldBM bitmap image used to construct an instance of this class
Returns:
nothing (ctor)

ColorImageData (  Bitmap  oldBM,
Color[]  oldPalette,
int  bpp
) 
 

Given a bitmap image and a palette (i.e., color lookup table used to translate scalar image values into other color values), this ctor reads the image data, uses the lookup table to store the pixel data in an array, and creates a displayable version of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in the bitmap.

Parameters:
oldBM bitmap image used to construct an instance of this class
oldPalette color lookup table
bpp bits-per-pixel
Returns:
nothing (ctor)

ColorImageData (  int[]  unpacked,
int  w,
int  h
) 
 

This ctor constructs a ColorImageData object from an array of rgb pixel values and the width and height of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in unpacked.

Parameters:
unpacked unpacked array of rgb values
w image width
h image height
Returns:
nothing (ctor)

int  col

Given a pixel's row and column location, this function returns the value of the pixel's red component.

void unpacked_rgb_to_display (  int[]  unpacked  ) 
 

This function takes an unpacked int array of rgb pixel values (representing an entire image), and copies the values to mDisplayData (also representing an entire image). mDisplayImage is changed to these values as well. mOriginalData remains unchanged. Note that unpacked must be the same size as the original image (mW*mH).

Parameters:
unpacked unpacked int array of rgb values (all values must be in [0..255] - no scaling will occur in this function - on the least significant 8 bits will be used)
Returns:
nothing (void)
